text: I'm Omer absolu
I'm vice president of technology and
yummy and gummy is a leading music
platform in the Middle East we provide
streaming to our users
everyone can install the application or
log into the website and listen to music
for free we also provide an anomalous
subscriptions which offers the user the
ability to stream songs offline and get
plurks we get our music legally from
labels and we pay royalties for music
labels so we ingest
all this data into RDS and we store the
music files into s3 with Amazon we just
have our API set up there we have s3 set
up behind the out front and serving the
music files for millions of our users
and it's all just very seamless at
amiami we use AWS since 2012
we started on AWS and we had a few other
servers running on different providers
but we dropped that and we moved
completely to AWS because it offers us a
lot we don't have to do a lot of system
admin work so we only have one dedicated
DevOps who's handling all the word we
use a plethora of services from AWS such
as RDS ec2 or HF gynesis
and a whole lot more and it's all really
good because we don't have a lot of
management to do we just thinking about
our application we're just thinking
about our user base how we want to drive
more user base drive more conversions so
we're just thinking about our end goals
and not thinking about the
infrastructure itself and that's what
AWS allows us to do furthermore AWS
provides a lot of solutions others and
relational databases and
ec2 instances such as DynamoDB year on
DynamoDB now we can store an infinite
amount of data for users and whenever we
need to query this data we have a very
strong consistent performance you just
need to think about your document
structure store it there and you don't
need to worry about disk space you have
an infinite amount of disk space you can
use as much as you want you don't worry
about your queries being not optimal
because you design your application in a
way that document based so you just get
the documents you want and you process
them so on dynamodb you'll end up saving
a lot of developer cost just to tweak
some features to work on RDS because
they're meant to be on dynamo the thing
we love about AWS is every year it's
adding more features adding more
services that allows us to do more AWS
is the perfect solution to bootstrap
your startup because you would have a
lot of service provided for you whereas
otherwise if you're going to implement
them yourself that's going to take a lot
of time and your competitors would be
out first in the market so AWS allows
you to develop your startup and your
application and be first to market and
reap the benefits of that
